title: Jack Eskridge
text:
John Wallace Eskridge (January 21, 1924 – February 11, 2013) was an American professional <a href="basketball">basketball</a> player. He spent one season in the <a href="Basketball%20Association%20of%20America">Basketball Association of America</a> (BAA) as a member of the <a href="Chicago%20Stags">Chicago Stags</a> and the <a href="Indianapolis%20Jets">Indianapolis Jets</a> (1948–49). He is also memorable for being the person who recruited basketball great <a href="Wilt%20Chamberlain">Wilt Chamberlain</a> to the <a href="University%20of%20Kansas">University of Kansas</a>, and for being the designer of the "star" logo of the <a href="Dallas%20Cowboys">Dallas Cowboys</a> <a href="American%20football">professional football</a> team in the <a href="NFL">NFL</a>.
Early years.
Eskridge was born on January 21, 1924, in <a href="Independence%2C%20Missouri">Independence, Missouri</a>. He attended <a href="William%20Chrisman%20High%20School">William Chrisman High School</a> where he played on the school's basketball team. After graduating high school he began attending <a href="Graceland%20University">Graceland University</a> where he played on the <a href="American%20football">football</a> and basketball teams. He was later inducted into the college's athletic <a href="hall%20of%20fame">hall of fame</a>. He joined the <a href="United%20States%20Marine%20Corps">United States Marine Corps</a> during <a href="World%20War%20II">World War II</a> where he served in the <a href="Pacific%20War">Pacific Theater</a>. During the war he was involved in the battle of Iwo Jima and witnessed both flag raisings.
University and professional athletics.
After Eskridge was relieved of duty he started attending the <a href="University%20of%20Kansas">University of Kansas</a> and played on the <a href="Kansas%20Jayhawks%20men%27s%20basketball">school's basketball team</a>. Once his professional playing career was over he coached the Atchison High School (Kansas) basketball team to a state championship before he joined the Kansas Jayhawks men's basketball team as their <a href="equipment%20manager">equipment manager</a> and <a href="assistant%20coach">assistant coach</a> under <a href="Phog%20Allen">Phog Allen</a> from 1954 to 1959. During his tenure, he recruited <a href="Wilt%20Chamberlain">Wilt Chamberlain</a>.
In 1959, Eskridge joined the <a href="Dallas%20Cowboys">Dallas Cowboys</a> football team as their equipment manager. He was credited with designing the Cowboys' star logo.
Later years.
After Eskridge's career with Dallas he moved to <a href="Independence%2C%20Missouri">Independence, Missouri</a>, where he coached basketball and taught high school for over 20 years. Eskridge died in Independence on February 11, 2013, at the age of 88.
